subpages.title: Overview
subpages.markdown: The Definitions Catalogue REST API allows you to search and browse the metadata for data definitions used by the Australian Government.

subpages.title: Base URL
subpages.markdown:
All URLs referenced in the documentation have the following base:

>https://definitions.ausdx.tk/api/

The Definitions Catalogue API is served over both HTTP and HTTPS.

subpages.title: The web version
subpages.markdown:
There is [web version of the catalogue](https://definitions.ausdx.tk) that mirrors the functionality of this API.

In general, the API uri's follow the same pattern as the web ones but with the '/api/' path segment removed.

For example:

- http://definitions.ausdx.tk/definition/other/de55
- http://definitions.ausdx.tk/api/definition/other/de55

So to get an easy head start on what you can do wit the API, head over to the web version and take a look.

subpages.title: HATEOS
Authentication
subpages.markdown:
This API is 100% public.

There is no Authentication

subpages.title: Rate Limiting
subpages.markdown:
At the moment there is no imposed rate limiting.

We'll monitor the service and impose limiting if the service is having trouble keeping up.
